metadata.title: CVE-2019-3462 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
Incorrect sanitation of the 302 redirect field in HTTP transport method ofapt versions 1.4.8 and earlier can lead to content injection by a MITMattacker, potentially leading to remote code execution on the targetmachine.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3462` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apt - 1.2.29ubuntu0.1
apt-transport-https - 1.2.29ubuntu0.1
apt-utils - 1.2.29ubuntu0.1
libapt-inst2.0 - 1.2.29ubuntu0.1
libapt-pkg5.0 - 1.2.29ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.29ubuntu0.1').
